notes.text:
An update for rh-nginx110-nginx is now available for Red Hat Software Collections.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
nginx is a web and proxy server supporting HTTP and other protocols, with a focus on high concurrency, performance, and low memory usage.

Security Fix(es):

* nginx: Denial of service and memory disclosure via mp4 module (CVE-2018-16845)

* nginx: Excessive memory consumption via flaw in HTTP/2 implementation (CVE-2018-16843)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Red Hat would like to thank the Nginx project for reporting these issues.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: nginx before versions 1.15.6 and 1.14.1 has a vulnerability in the implementation of HTTP/2 that can allow for excessive memory consumption. This issue affects nginx compiled with the ngx_http_v2_module (not compiled by default) if the 'http2' option of the 'listen' directive is used in a configuration file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: nginx: Excessive memory consumption via flaw in HTTP/2 implementation
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue did not affect the versions of rh-nginx18-nginx as shipped with Red Hat Software Collections as they did not include the vulnerable module ngx_http_v2_module.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The rh-nginx110-nginx service must be restarted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: nginx: Excessive memory consumption via flaw in HTTP/2 implementation

cwe.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Sent Data

notes.text: An instance of missing input sanitization was found in the mp4 module for nginx. A local attacker could create a specially crafted video file that, when streamed by the server, would cause a denial of service (server crash or hang) and, possibly, information disclosure.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: nginx: Denial of service and memory disclosure via mp4 module
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The rh-nginx110-nginx service must be restarted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: nginx: Denial of service and memory disclosure via mp4 module
